content.question: The author’s perspective in Source 2 best illustrates the fact that

choices.label: agricultural production was still carried out by small family units, even in industrialized countries
notions of women’s inferiority were still widespread, even among advocates for greater women’s rights
literacy rates among rural women expanded greatly, even as formal education remained limited mostly to the upper and middle classes
African women enjoyed a great degree of economic independence, even as colonial authorities sought to take it away from them

content.answer: notions of women’s inferiority were still widespread, even among advocates for greater women’s rights

topic.text: 9.5: Calls for Reform and Responses after 1900

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify a source's point of view, purpose, historical situation, and/or audience.
